paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information specifically for the KCNH2 gene, including penetrance data.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patient P1 was diagnosed with LQTS at age 22 after experiencing syncope.
Patient P2 reported palpitations and was diagnosed with LQTS at age 29.

individual_records.phenotype_details: No symptoms, carrier of KCNH2 variant
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patient P3 is a carrier of the KCNH2 variant but remains asymptomatic.
Patient P4 experienced cardiac arrest at age 45 and was diagnosed with LQTS at age 48.

functional_data.summary: Functional assays indicated that the KCNH2 variant leads to altered ion channel activity.

variants.segregation_data: The KCNH2 variant segregates with LQTS in affected family members.
variants.additional_notes: The study highlights the role of KCNH2 in LQTS and its variable penetrance.
key_quotes: The decreased penetrance... currently hinders the clinical utility of genetic testing.
A PRS consisting of 22 ‘QT-SNPs’ showed a strong association with the QT-interval in these patients.

extraction_metadata.notes: Extracted data was comprehensive and specific to the KCNH2 gene.
